subject: RE: [junit] Need help!!
msgSnippet: Not only is that a blanket statement, it _SEEMS_ thoroughly incorrect (I invoke the political ambiguity of _SEEMS_ because I don t care to squabble about
messageBody:
Not only is that a blanket statement, it _SEEMS_ thoroughly incorrect (I
invoke the political ambiguity of _SEEMS_ because I don't care to
squabble about semantics). I have written unit tests for legacy code,
and I know that many on this list have done the same, which is no
different than writing tests for code that is freshly written -- I don't
advocate that approach, but some like it. The process you are
describing, in part, is 'Test First Design' or 'Test Driven
Development'.

=jason

On Wed, 2003-02-26 at 09:28, Morten Grum, PH-Consult wrote:

The Unit test approach is "write the test before the code". So, if your
code
is done then yes it's too late. Then there isn't any unit test approach.
Just stick to use-case tests.

Morten
